contents:
1112 BREAKING: House Speaker Mike Johnson told House Republicans that he is hoping to vote on the Senate’s deal to end the government shutdown on Wednesday — CNN posted 2 days ago by _C_I_A_ 45 comments award share download report block
45 comments Sort by Top Top New Worst Old Save Elon Reveals the Real Reason He Walks Away From Trump Read More Ads by Ad.Style Kelemor88 28 points 2 days ago Why isnt it done today….. permalink award report block reply deleted 28 points 2 days ago POTUS_DonnieJ 34 points 2 days ago Never pass up a chance for a 7 week long vacation. permalink parent award report block reply deleted 20 points 2 days ago POTUS_DonnieJ 11 points 2 days ago Don’t disagree. The framers of he Constitution never intended for government to become full time life long careers for people. permalink parent award report block reply goldkeyboardwarrior 5 points 2 days ago Back then it could take days or even a week to get back home by horse so it made sense for them to only come to DC once a year and stay for a few weeks. Today there is no major city in the country more than a five hour flight away from Reagan except in Alaska and Hawaii which is about 9-12 hours away. permalink parent award report block reply view 5 more comments... His dad must have known he was going to be such a massive faggot and thus gave him an apt name. permalink parent award report block reply mohel 3 points 2 days ago He's a disappointment to his dad. permalink parent award report block reply view 2 more comments... jiujiujiu 3 points 2 days ago He is trying to protect his state from something stupid that is in the bill. He wants that thing removed from the bill and voted on separately so that he doesn’t betray his own state’s interests. It’s regarding the legal hemp industry which provides thousands of jobs for Kentucky. The bill, as is, will crush that industry. What’s the point of states having senators if they don’t protect their state’s interests? permalink parent award report block reply OutlawPurpleHairDye 5 points 2 days ago I'm guessing because the House has been as empty as Joe Biden's head for weeks and most members have left town and are just now coming back. permalink parent award report block reply Rydanovich 4 points 2 days ago Paperwork, mostly. Should have been no deal and Dems just sign what the House decided.
